page.title: 05Life in Tellisford.
page.content: The population of Tellisford and Vagg's Hill is about 55. There are 20 households; 9 containing children under 18 and 5 of retired people. Only 3 households do not have a car. Home life is centred on "do it yourself" with no one employing full-time cooks, gardeners or helps. Some people have part-time help for gardening or cleaning. Food is often stored in large deep-freezers and vegetable growing is very popular. The main meal of the day is usually in the evening, with everyone, including children eating together. There is no public transport. Only one house does not have a telephone. Mail is delivered and collected twice daily. 8 men are employed in dairy farming. 5 are self-employed businessmen working from home. There is 1 church minister and 3 people working outside the village.
